byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris and Jonathan Martin contributed reporting.

abstract: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and House Speaker Paul D Ryan say they support investigations into possibility that Russian cyberattacks were meant to influence 2016 presidential election; statements could put them at odds with Pres-elect Donald Trump, who has mocked idea and claimed CIA cannot be trusted.
lead_paragraph: Senator Mitch McConnell and Speaker Paul D. Ryan said they supported the investigations, setting up a possible conflict with President-elect Trump.
snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell and Speaker Paul D. Ryan said they supported the investigations, setting up a possible conflict with President-elect Trump....

headline.main: Senate and House Leaders Call for Inquiry of Russian Hacking in Election
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Feud Looms as Leaders Back Russia Inquiries
